channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Smart TV Makers Need to Kill Their Proprietary OSes
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Imagine a world where your smart TV's software is as reliable as your smartphone's.
item.content:encoded: It seems that almost every big TV brand has their own custom operating system, and that sounds reasonable, until you consider that smart TVs are basically big stationary smartphones these days.

item.title: 5 Movies to Watch on Prime Video This Week (October 6 - 12)
item.dc:creator: Chris Snellgrove
item.description: A new week means a new chance to watch some killer movies. From comedies to slashers, here are the best films to watch on Prime Video this week!
item.content:encoded: You know how it is: even though there are countless new movies to watch on streaming each month, it's hard to find something worth your time. But what if someone else figured it out and all you had to worry about was the popcorn?

item.title: 5 Must-See HBO Max Movies to Stream This Week (October 6 - 12)
item.dc:creator: Derek Malcolm
item.description: From Spooky Season horror and thrlls to epic sci-fi and stand-up comedy, HBO Max has you covered.
item.content:encoded: Finally, October is upon us, which means we can start trickling a few more Spooky Season movies into our watchlists to get us in the mood for Halloween.

item.title: Is Your iPhone Real? Here’s How to Check
item.dc:creator: Shan Abdul
item.content:encoded: Given their widespread demand, iPhones are one of the top targets for counterfeiting, and a good replica can closely resemble the original (even if only on first glance). If you’re planning to buy an iPhone from a third-party retailer—or have already purchased a used one from an unknown seller—here’s how to check whether it’s genuine.

item.title: How to Loop a Video on iPhone
item.dc:creator: Mahesh Makvana
T.M. Amrita
item.content:encoded: Using just the built-in features in the iPhone's Photos app, you can make your videos play in a loop for as long as you want. You can also do the same for YouTube videos using the native app. This eliminates the need to manually replay your videos, and we'll show you how to do that.

item.title: Here's Why RAM Should Be Your Priority When Buying a Laptop
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: RAM is the foundation of a fast laptop.
item.content:encoded: When shopping for a new laptop, it’s easy to get overwhelmed by those long lists of specs and features that retailers throw at you. However, there’s one spec every laptop has that you should never overlook: system memory, also known as RAM.

item.title: Here's How We Rank Every Friday the 13th Movie—Did We Get Anything Wrong?
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: Celebrate the slasher icon of summer camp with his ranked best movies.
item.content:encoded: Summer camps became a new scare location after the slasher franchise of Friday the 13th changed them forever. Born from tragedy, the slashing Jason Vorhees took out his revenge on the camp counselors who wronged him. Inspired by his mother, the masked man brutalizes any visitors to his grounds of dark lakes and creaky cabins.

item.title: PSA: Your USB Hub Might Be Hurting Your Laptop's Battery
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Don't think that hub gives you extra USB ports without any cost.
item.content:encoded: Laptops are pretty essential as on-the-go computers, but don’t always come with all the USB ports you need. That's why USB hubs have become a go-to solution for so many of us, turning a single port into a command center for all our gear. We plug in our external hard drives, keyboards, mice, and card readers without much thought.

item.title: 6 Ways to Make the Windows 11 Widgets Panel Actually Useful
item.dc:creator: Shan Abdul
item.description: Your Windows widget panel isn’t just dead space!
item.content:encoded: The Windows 11 widgets panel can be handy, but its out-of-the-box setup often feels messy. You’ll find widgets you may never use, others placed or sized inappropriately, and some that don’t display the correct information. Luckily, Windows lets you personalize this panel—and here’s how you can do it.

item.title: This $10 Smart Home Remote Is Exactly What My Home Assistant Setup Needed
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: My only regret is not buying more.
item.content:encoded: I spent $10 on a smart home remote on the off-chance that I’d find some use for it. Now I’m sad I only bought one, since I’ve found so many good uses for it in my Home Assistant smart home.
